intro: Staurogyne glauca var. neesii, commonly known as Nees's bluestem, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue-green foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pale blue or white, arranged in dense clusters.
